p: The standard curves for the four viruses were prepared by 10-fold serial dilution of standard plasmids ranging from 10 7 to 10 1 copies/μL as templates. The corresponding slope of the equation, correlation coefficient (R 2), and amplification efficiency (E) were as follows: −3.1611, 1.00, and 107% for CPV; −3.2261, 1.00, and 104% for CCoV; −3.3264, 1.00, and 100% for CaKoV; and −3.4054, 1.00, and 97% for CAstV ( Fig. 2 ), indicating an excellent linear equation and the standards were qualified.
